fields.hideLead: Hide a Lead in a call popup when Account / Contact are available
fields.displayPopupAfterAnswer: Display a popup only after answering the call
fields.useOutgoingCallRecording: Use different URL for outgoing calls

tooltips.serverUrl:
URL of your VoIP server in the format: 
- https://my-voip-server.com
- http://1.1.1.1
tooltips.host: IP or domain name of VoIP Server (e.g. Asterisk).
tooltips.port: Port for connection by AMI interface.
tooltips.scheme: Protocol that is used for connection for Asterisk server (TCP, UDP, TLS).
tooltips.connectTimeout: Timeout for connection to Asterisk server.
tooltips.asteriskVersion:
Version of your Asterisk server. Use these commands to check it: 
asterisk -r
core show version 
 OR 
 asterisk -V
tooltips.readTimeout: Timeout of read events from Asterisk server.
tooltips.channel:
Channel format for outgoing calls. 
It can be "PJSIP/###" (Asterisk 13+) or "SIP/###", where ### is a user’s extension (internal number). The extension "###" will be substituted automatically depending on the user.
tooltips.permittedEntities: Entities to be used for search a phone number.
tooltips.ignoredNumberList:
EspoCRM will ignore all numbers and popup window will not be displayed. 
Possible formats:
1. Regular expression - "#105#".
2. Phone number string - "11223344".
tooltips.activeQueues: Active queue IDs. This list will be used for handle incoming events for queues.
tooltips.quickCreateEntities: Entities which can be created through call popup.
tooltips.starfaceHost: IP or domain name of Starface Server.
tooltips.starfacePort: Port for connection to Starface Server.
tooltips.starfaceProtocol: Protocol (http, https) for connection to Starface Server.
tooltips.displayRelatedAccount: Display only Accounts related to Contacts. E.g. for incoming call the caller was found in Contacts, then display the related Account.
tooltips.playRecordings: If you want to have possibility to listen recorded calls. This option should also be enabled in your telephony server.
tooltips.autoOpenCallerInfo: Automatically open the caller information for incoming/outgoing calls. Order can be defined in the Permitted Entities field.
tooltips.recordingUrl:
URL used for playing recorded calls. Possible params: 
 "{UNIQUEID}" - ID of a call (e.g. uniqueid for Asterisk)
 "{DESTUNIQUEID}" - ID of a destination call
"{Y}" - year of a call
"{m}" - month of a call
"{d}" - day of a call.
tooltips.binotelKey: Authorization Key to the Binotel server.
tooltips.binotelSecret: Authorization Secret to the Binotel server.
tooltips.accessKey: The key to access to EspoCRM to handle incoming/outgoing calls
tooltips.internationalExitCode: Exit code for international calls. E.g. if you set "00", then all phone numbers will be replaced "+" into "00". Some examples:
tooltips.binotelUseSsl: Use SSL for connection to the server Binotel.
tooltips.agentRingingTimeout: The waiting limit in seconds to answer the call by the agent. E.g. for incoming call each agent will get a ringing duration of 20 seconds.
tooltips.preferAssignedUser: Assign a preferred user for incoming calls, sms/mms, e.g. for an incoming call, if the caller is found in EspoCRM, then Twilio will forward the call to the assigned user instead of the routing user list.
tooltips.defaultCountry: The country is used to format phone numbers. E.g. 02011112222 for United Kingdom will be formatted to +442011112222.
tooltips.dialFormat:
Phone number format for outgoing (click-to-call) calls. 
E.g. for "+44 (203) 111-22-33": 
{COUNTRY_CODE} - "44",
 {NATIONAL_NUMBER} - "2031112233".
tooltips.dialTimeout: The number of seconds that Twilio should allow the phone to ring before assuming there is no answer.
tooltips.autoSaveCall: Automatically save incoming/outgoing calls in the system without having to press "Save" button.
tooltips.sipDomains: The list of enabled Twilio SIP domains.
tooltips.hideLead: Hide a Lead in a call popup when Account / Contact are available
tooltips.binotelApiVersion: The version of the Binotel API which is used for integration
tooltips.displayPopupAfterAnswer: Do not show incoming call popups until the user answers a call
tooltips.useOutgoingCallRecording: The same option as "Listen recorded calls", but only for outgoing calls.
tooltips.outgoingCallRecordingUrl: URL for playing recorded calls for outgoing calls only. See "Listen recorded calls" option for more details.

help.Asterisk:
**Configuring Asterisk Integration.**

You can configure access information to your Asterisk Server and some additional options. Your Asterisk Server should have enabled Asterisk Manager Interface (AMI). Setup instructions: [https://docs.espocrm.com/extensions/voip-integration/asterisk-integration-setup](https://docs.espocrm.com/extensions/voip-integration/asterisk-integration-setup/).

**Setup Asterisk Events:**

To handle incoming/outgoing calls, add this line to the crontab (scheduled tasks): ```{voipCron}``` 

**CallerID Lookup (optional):**

This feature provides possibilities to use CallerID Lookup functionality to identify the caller by his phone number. Configure your Asterisk server to make a GET request to this URL: ```{voipCidlookupUrl}``` 

where

*   [NUMBER] — incoming phone number which is replaced by Asterisk server.

**Post incoming events (optional):**

If you need to display any additional events in the EspoCRM, you can configure your Asterisk Server to make a POST request to the URL: ```{voipPostUrl}``` 

where

*   PHONE_NUMBER — incoming/outgoing phone number;
*   USER_EXTENSION — EspoCRM user's extension;
*   ASTERISK_UNIQUEID — call ID in the Asterisk Server (uniqueid).
help.Starface:
**Configuring Starface Integration.**

You can configure access information to your Starface Server and some additional options. Setup instructions: [https://docs.espocrm.com/extensions/voip-integration/starface-integration-setup](https://docs.espocrm.com/extensions/voip-integration/starface-integration-setup/).

**Setup Starface Events:**

To handle incoming/outgoing calls, add this line to the crontab (scheduled tasks): ```{voipCron}```
help.Binotel:
**Configuring Binotel Integration.**

You can configure access information to your Starface Server and some additional options. Setup instructions: [https://docs.espocrm.com/extensions/voip-integration/binotel-integration-setup](https://docs.espocrm.com/extensions/voip-integration/binotel-integration-setup/).

**Authorization:**

You have to fill the Key and Secret fields for connection to Binotel server.

**Setup Binotel Events:**

To handle incoming/outgoing calls, contact Binotel support to add the following URL to WebHook events: 
- apiCallSettings
- receivedTheCall
- answeredTheCall
- apiCallCompleted 

```{voipPostUrl}```
help.Twilio:
**Configuring Twilio Integration.**

You can configure access information to Twilio and some additional options. Setup instructions: [https://docs.espocrm.com/extensions/voip-integration/twilio-integration-setup](https://docs.espocrm.com/extensions/voip-integration/twilio-integration-setup/).

**Authorization:**

You have to fill your Account SID and Auth Token for using Twilio API. These information can be found at [www.twilio.com/console](https://www.twilio.com/console).

**Routing Configuration:**

All available Twilio phone numbers will be imported to EspoCRM after successful connection. This process can take up to 5 minutes. For routing configuration go to [VoIP Routers](#VoipRouter) section.

Note: All new phone numbers are inactive by default. Enable them after routing configuration.

**SIP Configuration (optional):**

If you need to use Twilio SIP trunk in EspoCRM, you have to make the following configuration steps:

1.  Configure a SIP Domain in Twilio.
2.  Enable this SIP Domain in EspoCRM connector.
3.  Add a SIP URI (username@SIPDomain) to a user profile in EspoCRM.

Detailed instructions are available at the link: [https://www.espocrm.com/features/twilio-integration](https://www.espocrm.com/features/twilio-integration/#user-content-how-to-configure-sip-domains).
help.IexPBX:
**Configuring iexPBX Integration**

You can configure an integration with your iexPBX Server. More details: [https://docs.espocrm.com/extensions/voip-integration/iexpbx-integration-setup](https://docs.espocrm.com/extensions/voip-integration/iexpbx-integration-setup/).

**Authorization:**

In order to configure the integration, please fill in your iexPBX server details: 
- Server URL
- API User
- API Secret

**Setup iexPBX Events:**

To handle incoming/outgoing calls, login to a web panel of your iexPBX server, go to Settings, API Integrations and define the following WebHooks:
- Arama Bilgisi Gönder:

```{voipPostUrl}?chanid={chanid}&src={src}&dst={dst}&type={calltype}``` 

- Kapatma Bilgisi Gönder:

```{voipPostUrl}?chanid={chanid}&status={status}&duration={duration}```

labels.errorLoadingSipDomains: Error loading SIP domains. Account SID or Auth Token are incorrect.
